medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after having a cup of tea on the evening at 5 pm, characterized by constant RUQ burning pain similar to prior attacks but persistent this time. The patient denies nausea and vomiting currently.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, obesity, history of similar episodes of RUQ pain, gallbladder polyp as shown in prior ultrasound, previous shoulder operations, and hernia repair over 5 years ago.
